remarks: If from the proposition that ` x ` has property ` A ` , whatever ` x ` may be, it can be inferred that every result of an application of the procedure ` R ` to ` x ` has property ` A ` , then property ` A ` is hereditary in the ` R ` -sequence.  Proposition 75 of [Frege1879] p. 60.  (Contributed by RP, 28-Mar-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
frege75 $p |- ( A. x ( x e. A -> A. y ( x R y -> y e. A ) ) -> R hereditary A ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d R x y $.
